Key Arguments: The legislation breaches the rule of law by exempting government members and public servants from compliance.
It creates a double standard where the government can disseminate misinformation without consequence.
The legislation stifles debate on important societal issues by labeling dissenting opinions as misinformation.
The bill represents an overreach of government power and undermines democracy and human rights.
Notable Quotes: The so-called Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) Bill 2023 is a profound breach of the rule of law.
No longer will anyone be permitted to debate issues... when someone in government or the public service propounds that ‘the science is settled’.
If Australia is to be a beacon for the rule of law... this proposed legislation must not be passed.
